paragraph: Scott Joss (born 1962) is a songwriter, guitarist, mandolin player, singer, and fiddle player primarily in the American Country music tradition who has performed with Merle Haggard, Dwight Yoakam, Pete Anderson, Tiny Moore, Roy Nichols, Dusty Wakeman, Kris Kristofferson and Jana Jae and is a successful solo artist.

Born in Santa Monica, California in 1962 and raised in Redding, California, Joss learned to play fiddle from Jana Jae, the one-time wife and fiddle player for Buck Owens and his Buckaroos.  Praised as "the heir to the Bakersfield throne" because of his early association with Bakersfield Sound musicians, Joss' playing has been key to hit tunes scored by Merle Haggard & The Strangers and Dwight Yoakam. Scott Joss
2000: A New Reason to Care (Little Dog)
2018: How Far to Jordan (Miracle Mile Records) The album has tracks that feature Kris Kristofferson
1988: Dwight Yoakam – Buenas Noches from a Lonely Room  (Reprise)
1990: Dwight Yoakam – If There Was a Way (Reprise)
1998: Dwight Yoakam – A Long Way Home (Reprise)
2001: Dwight Yoakam – South of Heaven, West of Hell (Warner Bros.)
2003: Merle Haggard – Haggard Like Never Before (Hag Records)
2007: Merle Haggard – The Bluegrass Sessions (McCoury Music)
2010: Merle Haggard – I Am What I Am (Vanguard)
Scott Joss has a Fan Group on Facebook
